alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Henrico; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond) (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 11:29AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henrico County and the City of Richmond through NOON EDT... At 1128 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bellwood, or near Chester, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. In addition, Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. While a tornado is not immediately likely, remain alert for any warnings. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Henrico County and the City of Richmond, including the following locations... Varina, Richmond Heights, Centralia and Montrose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Henrico; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond)
